example: Prairie dogs inhabit vast networks of burrows in the North American grasslands.
The black-footed ferret, which preys on prairie dogs, is an endangered species.
Overgrazing has turned many fertile fields into depleted, barren lands.
There is ongoing controversy about whether to cull prairie dog colonies to protect crops.
Cattle graze alongside prairie dog towns, sometimes disturbing their burrows.
Prairie dogs maintain complex burrow systems with multiple entrances and chambers.
Flooding is a major hazard for prairie dog burrows during the rainy season.

chinese: 瘟疫;(老鼠或昆虫等肆虐造成的)灾害
example: Sylvatic plague, spread by fleas, has decimated prairie dog populations.
Fleas can infect prairie dogs with deadly diseases like the plague.
Infected fleas transmit the plague bacteria between prairie dogs.
Prairie dogs play a vital ecological role in maintaining grassland health.
Prairie dogs have a reputation for being pests due to their burrowing habits.
Farmers sometimes use prairie dog habitats as feed for livestock.

chinese: 草原犬鼠(生活于北美地穴)
example: Prairie dogs are social rodents that live in large colonies called towns.
Fleas are common parasites on prairie dogs and other small mammals.

chinese: 蝾螈(两栖动物，形似蜥蜴)
example: Some salamander species take shelter in abandoned prairie dog burrows.
Coyotes often prey on prairie dogs, helping to control their population.
Prairie dogs can detect predators like coyotes from great distances.
Soil drift can sometimes block the entrances to prairie dog burrows.
A prairie dog will stay motionless when it senses a potential threat.
Environmentalists have raised objections to the poisoning of prairie dog colonies.

chinese: 抢购，赶紧买下（便宜或心仪之物）
example: Collectors sometimes snap up prairie dog-themed merchandise at wildlife parks.
Cuttlefish, like other cephalopods, have remarkable camouflage abilities.
Cuttlefish are close relatives of octopuses and squids.

chinese: 头足动物(如章鱼和乌贼)
example: Cephalopods like cuttlefish have highly developed nervous systems.
Cuttlefish often hide among underwater debris to avoid predators.
Cuttlefish can change skin color by manipulating pigmented particles called chromatophores.
It's difficult to spot a cuttlefish when it blends into its surroundings.
The cuttlefish's ability to mimic patterns is nothing short of startling.

chinese: 脆弱的;(身体上或感情上)易受…伤害的
example: Young cuttlefish are particularly vulnerable to predation in their first weeks of life.
